hints.title: Lovelock's Theorem
hints.content:
17: :label: thm-lovelock-uniqueness
18: 
19: In a 4-dimensional spacetime $(M, g_{\mu\nu})$, the **Einstein tensor**
20: 
21: $$
22: G_{\mu\nu} := R_{\mu\nu} - \frac{1}{2}R g_{\mu\nu}
23: $$
24: 
25: is the unique symmetric rank-2 tensor satisfying:
26: 
27: 1. **Metric dependence**: $G_{\mu\nu}[g]$ depends only on the metric $g_{\mu\nu}$ and its derivatives up to second order
28: 2. **Linearity in second derivatives**: $G_{\mu\nu}$ is linear in $\partial^2 g$
29: 3. **Divergence-free**: $\nabla_\mu G^{\mu\nu} = 0$ identically (Bianchi identity)
